title: failing to prepare/publish a new dataset
body:
protocol of struggle is below...  feels that both create-publication-target and publish might be better if each step had independent check if remote location is up to what is expected, and "fixed" it if not. But may be it is all just ramification of #432 and #463 so it would be great if those was resolved asap.

``` shell
(git)smaug:/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openfmri/ds000171[master]git
$> git remote remove datalad-public
(venv-tests)1 10064.....................................:Thu 09 Jun 2016 02:47:28 PM EDT:.
(git)smaug:/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openfmri/ds000171[master]git
$> datalad --dbg create-publication-target-sshwebserver -l debug --recursive --shared all --existing=replace ssh://datasets.datalad.org/srv/datasets.datalad.org/www/openfmri/ds000171 datalad-public
2016-06-09 14:47:30,929 [DEBUG  ] Resolved dataset for target creation: <Dataset path=/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openfmri/ds000171> (create_publication_target_sshwebserver.py:149)
2016-06-09 14:47:30,964 [INFO   ] Connecting ... (create_publication_target_sshwebserver.py:191)
2016-06-09 14:47:30,964 [DEBUG  ] Try starting control master by calling:
| ssh -o ControlMaster=auto -o "ControlPath=/home/yoh/.config/datalad/datasets.datalad.org" -o ControlPersist=yes datasets.datalad.org exit (sshconnector.py:102)

$> datalad --dbg publish -r -l debug datalad-public
```
